description: Creates an alias for a Lambda function version. Use aliases to provide clients with a function identifier that you can update to invoke a different version. You can also map an alias to split invocation requests between two versions. Use the RoutingConfig parameter to specify a second version and the percentage of invocation requests that it receives.

parameters.name: FunctionName
parameters.description: The name or ARN of the Lambda function. Function name - MyFunction. Function ARN - arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:123456789012:function:MyFunction. Partial ARN - 123456789012:function:MyFunction. The length constraint applies only to the full ARN. If you specify only the function name, it is limited to 64 characters in length.

parameters.name: FunctionVersion
parameters.description: The function version that the alias invokes.

parameters.name: RoutingConfig
parameters.description: The routing configuration of the alias. AdditionalVersionWeights (dict) --- The second version, and the percentage of traffic that's routed to it. (string) --- (float) ---

nested_params.name: AdditionalVersionWeights
nested_params.description: The second version, and the percentage of traffic that's routed to it.

nested_items.name: AliasArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alias.

nested_items.name: FunctionVersion
nested_items.description: The function version that the alias invokes.

nested_items.name: RoutingConfig
nested_items.description: The routing configuration of the alias.

nested_items.name: AdditionalVersionWeights
nested_items.description: The second version, and the percentage of traffic that's routed to it.

nested_items.name: RevisionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier that changes when you update the alias.
